com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.multi

Class MultiServiceEventClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.multi.MultiServiceEventClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MesosEventClient

    public class MultiServiceEventClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements MesosEventClient
    An implementation of MesosEventClient which wraps multiple running services, routing Mesos events to each service appropriately. The underlying running services are stored within a provided MultiServiceManager.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MultiServiceEventClient.UninstallCallback
      Interface for notifying the caller that an added service has completed uninstalling and has been removed.

      • registered

        public void registered(boolean reRegistered)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • unregistered

        public void unregistered()
        Description copied from interface: MesosEventClient
        Called after the framework has been unregistered from Mesos following a call to MesosEventClient.offers(Collection) which returned OfferResponse#readyToUninstall() as a response. When this is called, the service should advertise the completion of the uninstall operation in its deploy plan.
        Specified by:
        unregistered in interface MesosEventClient

      • getClientStatus

        public MesosEventClient.ClientStatusResponse getClientStatus()
        Returns our status to the upstream OfferProcessor. The logic is as follows:

        1. If no services are present: uninstall mode: IDLE/REMOVE_CLIENT, otherwise: IDLE/NONE
        2. If all services are idle: IDLE/NONE
        3. If any service is collecting footprint: WORKING/FOOTPRINT, with newWork=true if any service had newWork=true
        4. Else (mix of zero or more IDLE/* and zero or more WORKING/*): WORKING/LAUNCH, with newWork=true if any service had newWork=true
        Specified by:
        getClientStatus in interface MesosEventClient

      • offers

        public MesosEventClient.OfferResponse offers(java.util.Collection<Protos.Offer> offers)
        Forwards the provided offer(s) to all enclosed services, seeing which services are interested in them. The services which actually receive offers is decided by their status response to getClientStatus(), as well as the configured OfferDiscipline.
        Specified by:
        offers in interface MesosEventClient
        Parameters:
        offers - A list of offers which may be used in offer evaluation
        Returns:
        The response containing a list of operations to be performed against the offers, as well as a list of offers which were left unused. See MesosEventClient.OfferResponse

      • getUnexpectedResources

        public MesosEventClient.UnexpectedResourcesResponse getUnexpectedResources(java.util.Collection<Protos.Offer> unusedOffers)
        Maps the reserved resources in the provided unused offers according to the services that own them, then queries those services directly to see what resources they consider unexpected.

        This is an optimization which avoids querying services about unexpected resources that don't relate to them.

        In addition to reducing unnecessary queries, this also improves isolation between services. They only see resources which relate to them.

        Specified by:
        getUnexpectedResources in interface MesosEventClient
        Parameters:
        unusedOffers - The list of offers which were unclaimed in a prior call to MesosEventClient.offers(Collection)
        Returns:
        A subset of the provided offers paired with their resources to be unreserved/destroyed. May be paired with an error state if remaining unused offers should be declined-short rather than declined-long.

      • taskStatus

        public MesosEventClient.TaskStatusResponse taskStatus(Protos.TaskStatus status)
        Maps the provided status to the service that owns its task, then queries that service with the status.

        This is an optimization which avoids querying services about task statuses that don't relate to them.

        In addition to reducing unnecessary queries, this also improves isolation between services. They only see task statuses which relate to them.

        Specified by:
        taskStatus in interface MesosEventClient
        Parameters:
        status - The status message describing the new state of a task
        Returns:
        The response which describes whether the status was successfully processed

      • getHTTPEndpoints

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> getHTTPEndpoints()
        Returns a set of multi-service-specific endpoints to be served by the scheduler. This effectively overrides the underlying per-service endpoints with multiservice-aware versions.
        Specified by:
        getHTTPEndpoints in interface MesosEventClient
        Returns:
        A list of annotated resource objects to be served by Jetty
